hero.title: Celeste's Garden
hero.subtitle: Mockup of an online clothing e-commerce website created on Figma as part of a design course.

context.label: Context
context.title: A First Educational Exercise
paragraphs: This project was completed as part of my Professional Design Degree at Sorbonne University, under the supervision of Julien Crusson. These are my first interface mockups, created for a fictional e-commerce clothing website.
The goal was to design an online retail site by applying the fundamental principles of web design and UX learned in class.

learnings.label: Learnings
learnings.title: Applied Design Principles
learnings.intro: Theoretical concepts put into practice in this first project:

principles.title: User-Centered Design
principles.description: Understanding user needs to create adapted interfaces. Reflection on different visitor profiles of an e-commerce site.

principles.title: Information Architecture
principles.description: Organizing content logically: navigation between categories, product pages, cart, and checkout process.

principles.title: Visual Hierarchy
principles.description: Guiding the eye with size and spacing. Highlighting products and call-to-action buttons for purchasing.

principles.title: Visual Consistency
principles.description: Maintaining consistency across pages with reusable components created in Figma.

principles.title: Responsive Design
principles.description: Adapting the interface to mobile constraints with generous touch areas and simplified navigation.

principles.title: Accessibility
principles.description: Attention to color contrasts and text sizes for an interface readable by everyone.

projectFooter.title: About the Program
projectFooter.description: Professional Design Degree at Sorbonne University. Training focused on interface design, UX and web design.
